Bioinformatics Awareness Days (BAD days)

The Bioinformatics Awareness Days are days devoted to Bioinformatics. As a Marie S. Curie postdoctoral fellow @ SITRaN and Computer Science Departments at the University of Sheffield, I organized such an event to give my practical contribution in Bioinformatics, although I have to state that all this started in Naples at the Telethon Institute of Genetics and Medicine, with the great Bionformatics Core.


Important

Make sure to visit the Getting started section of this page before proceeding to any of the course modules.

Getting started

This section contains vital information about the course content and the requirements.


Day 1

R&Bioconductor and Multiple hypothesis testing



Day 2

Analysis of variance, GLM, and dimensionality reduction



Day 3

RNA-Sequencing data work-flow example
